newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai soybeans end down on bearish sentiment.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai soybeans end down on bearish sentiment.

text.p: Shanghai soybean futures ended down across the board on Friday following Thursday's slight fall with investors pessimistic about the market trend, traders said.
The most active September contract fell three to close at 3,330 yuan ($401) per tonne. It opened at 3,340, hitting an intraday high of 3,348 and a low of 3,328.
March fell 13 to 3,095, May five to 3,155, July 61 to 3,309, November four to 3,337 and the January 1998 contract four to 3,344. Combined volume rose to 21,300 tonnes from 16,900.
